CatDescriptText: Mrs. Flora Reddish, housewife, Garfield and Mr. L. Montgomery, East Liberty, were part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier Newspaper, February 17, 1962, pg. A3 with question: "Do you think Bible reading in public schools is constitutional or unconstitutional?" Mrs. Flora Reddish's answer reads: "I think it's all right.  You're never too young to learn about the Bible."  Mr. L. Montgomery's answer reads: "I think it's constitutional for the simple reason that our country was founded on the principles found in the Bible."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of Flora Reddish wearing eyeglasses and double breasted overcoat, standing in front of C.A. Michel store with Pittsburgh Paints sign, Smithfield Street, Downtown; Portrait of L. Montgomery wearing fedora with dark band, plaid shirt, and dark overcoat, standing in front of Brass Rail Restaurant, Smithfield Street, Downtown
